title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: anything else, need determine events like display Clinical Timelines, data domains contain variables needed plot events. example app, like display occurrences adverse events, respective treatment start end dates subject, well drug administration events. order , need identify data domains hold variables determined events. Besides, module requires mandatory subject level dataset. demonstration purposes, use dummy data {pharmaverseadam} R package: adsl subject level dataset optional events “Treatment Start” “Treatment End” adae optional event “Adverse Events” adex optional “Drug Administration” event Make sure provide data named list. load clinical data, can use DaVinci’s Data Loader package ({dv.loader}). example, just put datasets mentioned named list:
code: data_list <- list(   adsl = pharmaverseadam::adsl,   adae = pharmaverseadam::adae,   adex = pharmaverseadam::adex )

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: According data requirements (see vignette("data-requirements")), loaded datasets need preprocessing ready used {dv.clinlines}. adae adcm data data_list contain columns datetimes actually type datetime. following lines code convert columns type character POSIXct means ymd_hm() function ofthe {lubridate} R package, mutate() function {dplyr} R package. Note drop adverse events missing start dates simplification purposes.
code: library(magrittr)  data_list$adsl <- data_list$adsl %>%   dplyr::mutate(     TRTSDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(TRTSDT, truncated = 2),     TRTEDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(TRTEDT, truncated = 2),     RFICDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(RFSTDTC, truncated = 2)   )  data_list$adae <- data_list$adae %>%   dplyr::filter(!is.na(ASTDT)) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     AESTDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(ASTDT, truncated = 2),     AEENDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(AENDT, truncated = 2)   )  data_list$adex <- data_list$adex %>%   dplyr::mutate(     EXSTDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(EXSTDTC, truncated = 2),     EXENDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(EXENDTC, truncated = 2),   )

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: desired study data loaded ready displayed Clinical Timelines module application, module list needs defined Module Manage. {dv.clinlines} provides wrapper function defines module given specifications. Clinical Timelines highly customizable, mod_clinical_timelines() expects extensive information study data used. parameters wrapper function explained detail better understanding. might feel overwhelming beginning, {dv.clinlines} offers helper functions simplify set-bit. described afterwards - let’s introduce wrapper first.

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: Mandatory parameters : module_id: module module list needs unique identifier, provided string. basic_info: Assigns name subject level dataset variable names treatment start end, informed consent variables. must contain following elements: data: Character name subject level analysis dataset (e.g. “adsl”, “dm”) called data list provided modulemanager. trt_start: Character name variable contains treatment start dates must present dataset mentioned data element. trt_end: Character name variable contains treatment end dates must present dataset mentioned data element. icf_date: Character name variable contains informed consent dates must present dataset mentioned data element. mapping: list lists. serves instruction event take data domain / dataset, variables take start end values, etc., plotted clinical timelines. lists needs follow strict hierarchy. must contain one entry per dataset/domain serves basis events. entries need named according names data list provided Module Manager. entries oneself must lists. second level lists contain variable names needed plot events, gathered yet another lists, named according labels shall assigned event, contain following elements . possible define multiple events one dataset, multiple datasets mapping list. start_dt_var: Character name variable contains either event start dates (interval events) merely timepoints (e.g. milestones). variable name must present dataset event listed. end_dt_var: Character name variable contains event end dates. Needs provided interval events, set NULL timepoints. variable name must present dataset event listed. start_dy_var: Similar start_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. end_dy_var: Similar end_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. detail_var: Character name variable contains descriptive information shall displayed event. Can set NULL information. drug_admin: list named character strings describes variables use display drug administration events. NULL, must contain following elements: name: Character name dataset holds drug administration data (e.g. ex domain), called datalist provided modulemanager. start_var: Character name variable contains start dates (e.g. exposure start dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. end_var: Character name variable contains end dates (e.g. exposure end dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. detail_var: Character name variable contains treatment information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. label: Free-text character label drug administration event. exp_dose: Character name variable contains dosis level information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. exp_dose_unit: Character name variable contains dosis unit. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. Optional parameters mod_clinical_timelines() : subjid_var: Defaults “USUBJID”. Specifies name unique subject identifier variable datasets. Must single character value. ms: Single numeric value. Defaults 1000, means plotting main view performed 1000 milliseconds delay. useful improve performance, especially dataset large multiple adverse event filters activated. filter: Defaults NULL, means local filters adverse event data offered within module. Filters can activated providing names list (see vignette("ae-filter")). receiver_id: Character string defining ID module send subject ID. corresponding module must exist module list. default NULL disables communication. See vignette("communication") information. illustrative definition module list (containing Clinical Timelines module mandatory parameters) shown : example concludes module displays treatment start dates timepoint events (bullets timeline), adverse events, well drug administration periods time intervals (horizontal bars). sake simplicity, optional parameters set .
code: module_list <- list(   "Clinical Timelines" = dv.clinlines::mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod1",     basic_info = list(       data = "adsl",       trt_start = "TRTSDT",       trt_end = "TRTEDT",       icf_date = "RFICDT"     ),     mapping = list(       adsl = list(         "Treatment Start" = list(           start_dt_var = "TRTSDT",           end_dt_var = NULL,           start_dy_var = NULL,           end_dy_var = NULL,           detail_var = NULL         ),       ),       adae = list(         "Adverse Events" = list(           start_dt_var = "AESTDTC",           end_dt_var = "AEENDTC",           start_dy_var = NULL,           end_dy_var = NULL,           detail_var = "AEDECOD"         )       )     ),     drug_admin = list(       name = "adex",       start_var = "EXSTDTC",       end_var = "EXENDTC",       detail_var = "EXTRT",       label = "Drug Administration",       exp_dose = "EXDOSE",       exp_dose_unit = "EXDOSU"     )   ) )

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: configuration Clinical Timelines module error-prone. Therefore, {dv.clinlines} offers several helper functions generate lists basic_info, mapping, drug_admin. functions take variable names input parameters return list can directly used wrapper parameters. intention reduce errors produced typos missing/wrongly named list elements. See help pages detailed information work. demonstration, defined module . time, use helper functions instead typing lists : details specifying local adverse event filters can found vignette("ae-filter"). communication feature DaVinci modules described vignette("communication"). information define module lists multiple modules, see articles creating apps documentation {dv.manager}.
code: library(dv.clinlines)  module_list <- list(   "Clinical Timelines" = mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod1",     basic_info = set_basic_info(       data = "adsl",       trt_start = "TRTSDT",       trt_end = "TRTEDT",       icf_date = "RFICDT"     ),     mapping = list(       adsl = list(         "Treatment Start" = set_event(start_dt_var = "TRTSDT")       ),       adae = list(         "Adverse Events" = set_event(           start_dt_var = "AESTDTC",           end_dt_var = "AEENDTC",           detail_var = "AEDECOD"         )       )     ),     drug_admin = set_drug_admin(       name = "adex",       start_var = "EXSTDTC",       end_var = "EXENDTC",       detail_var = "EXTRT",       label = "Drug Administration",       exp_dose = "EXDOSE",       exp_dose_unit = "EXDOSU"     )   ) )

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: Use run_app() {dv.manager} package launch application specified modules. Note loaded data list wrapped named list.
code: dv.manager::run_app(   data = list("my_data" = data_list),   module_list = module_list,   filter_data = "adsl" )

title: {dv.clinlines} and {dv.manager}
text: convenience, code chunks scattered across page gathered together :
code: library(magrittr) library(dv.clinlines)  # Load data data_list <- list(   adsl = pharmaverseadam::adsl,   adae = pharmaverseadam::adae,   adex = pharmaverseadam::adex )  # Preprocess data data_list$adsl <- data_list$adsl %>%   dplyr::mutate(     TRTSDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(TRTSDT, truncated = 2),     TRTEDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(TRTEDT, truncated = 2),     RFICDT = lubridate::ymd_hm(RFSTDTC, truncated = 2)   )  data_list$adae <- data_list$adae %>%   dplyr::filter(!is.na(ASTDT)) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     AESTDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(ASTDT, truncated = 2),     AEENDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(AENDT, truncated = 2)   )  data_list$adex <- data_list$adex %>%   dplyr::mutate(     EXSTDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(EXSTDTC, truncated = 2),     EXENDTC = lubridate::ymd_hm(EXENDTC, truncated = 2),   )  # Configurate module module_list <- list(   "Clinical Timelines" = mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod1",     basic_info = set_basic_info(       data = "adsl",       trt_start = "TRTSDT",       trt_end = "TRTEDT",       icf_date = "RFICDT"     ),     mapping = list(       adsl = list(         "Treatment Start" = set_event(start_dt_var = "TRTSDT")       ),       adae = list(         "Adverse Events" = set_event(           start_dt_var = "AESTDTC",           end_dt_var = "AEENDTC",           detail_var = "AEDECOD"         )       )     ),     drug_admin = set_drug_admin(       name = "adex",       start_var = "EXSTDTC",       end_var = "EXENDTC",       detail_var = "EXTRT",       label = "Drug Administration",       exp_dose = "EXDOSE",       exp_dose_unit = "EXDOSU"     )   ) )  # Launch app dv.manager::run_app(   data = list("my_data" = data_list),   module_list = module_list,   filter_data = "adsl" )

what: Activate communication on Clinical Timelines module side
title: Communication with DaVinci modules
text: default receiver_id parameter mod_clinical_timelines() call module list definition set NULL means communication functionality disabled. enable switching another DaVinci module, set receiver_id module ID counterpart module.

title: Communication with DaVinci modules
text: Example code module list definition turn communication feature Clinical Timelines Patient Profile module:
code: module_list <- list(   "Clinical Timelines" = mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod1",     basic_info = set_basic_info(       data = "adsl",       trt_start = "TRTSDT",       trt_end = "TRTEDT",       icf_date = "RFICDT"     ),     mapping = list(       adsl = list("Treatment Start" = set_event(start_dt_var = "TRTSDT"))     ),     drug_admin = set_drug_admin(       name = "adex",       start_var = "EXSTDTC",       end_var = "EXENDTC",       detail_var = "EXTRT",       label = "Drug Administration",       exp_dose = "EXDOSE",       exp_dose_unit = "EXDOSU"     ),     receiver_id = "mod2"   ),   # Note that the focus here lies on the sender_ids parameter, not on the set up of mod_patient_profile()   "Patient Profiles" = dv.papo::mod_patient_profile(     module_id = "mod2",     subjid_var = "USUBJID",     sender_ids = "mod1"   ) )

title: Quality Control
text: Date: 2024-Aug-01 08:59:05 following document generates report R packages, satisfy criteria “Released” status Non-GxP project. QC report contains following information: Specifications (specs): can attached every test user adds. Traceability matrix: Contains test cases passed, failed, skipped expectations. Uncovered undeclared specs Session Info System Configuration Please advised QC report generated module imply validation according GxP criteria. QC report satisfies internally developed quality checks non-GxP criteria. clinical reporting purposes, essential note outputs generated using module must checked verified within validated system adheres appropriate GxP guidelines.

title: dv.clinlines
text: Clinical Timelines module DaVinci’s {dv.clinlines} package displays subject level data time present dates /time intervals pre-specified events, like adverse events, concomitant medications, randomization dates, . Events show can chosen needed. Periods drug administration displayed special way, indicating dose changes. module offers overview events subjects. adverse event data, supplementary local filters can added.  module prepared used combination DaVinci’s {dv.manager} package supports bookmarking functionality. also allows enable communication DaVinci modules drilling particular subjects (case, communication means send unique subject ID).

title: dv.clinlines
text: Feel free copy following code chunk install latest version {dv.clinlines}.

title: dv.clinlines
text: {dv.clinlines} provides mock function launch module dummy data {pharmaverseadam} R package demonstration purposes: launch Clinical Timelines module data using {dv.manager}, add module module list. code shows example definition one-item module list. setup mapping parameter concludes plot shows Treatment Start Treatment End Points, well Adverse Event Drug Administration periods. See vignette("clinlines") information use {dv.clinlines} {dv.manager}. Usage helper default functions also explained .
code: dv.clinlines::mock_clinical_timelines_app() module_list <- list(   "Clinical Timelines" = dv.clinlines::mod_clinical_timelines(     module_id = "mod1",     basic_info = list(       data = "adsl",       trt_start = "TRTSDT",       trt_end = "TRTEDT",       icf_date = "RFICDT"     ),     mapping = list(       adsl = list(         "Treatment Start" = list(           start_dt_var = "TRTSDT",           end_dt_var = NULL,           start_dy_var = NULL,           end_dy_var = NULL,           detail_var = NULL         ),         "Treatment End" = list(           start_dt_var = "TRTEDT",           end_dt_var = NULL,           start_dy_var = NULL,           end_dy_var = NULL,           detail_var = NULL         )       ),       adae = list(         "Adverse Events" = list(           start_dt_var = "AESTDTC",           end_dt_var = "AEENDTC",           start_dy_var = NULL,           end_dy_var = NULL,           detail_var = "AEDECOD"         )       )     ),     drug_admin = list(       name = "exp",       start_var = "EXSTDTC",       end_var = "EXENDTC",       detail_var = "EXTRT",       label = "Drug Administration",       exp_dose = "EXDOSE",       exp_dose_unit = "EXDOSU"     )   ) )

title: Combine subject level, event, and drug administration data frames — combine_data

text: data frame provided via combined_data parameter additional columns: start_dy_var: Event start days relative study start. end_dy_var: Event end days relative study start. start_exp_day: Start time exp intervals days relative study start. end_exp_day: End time exp intervals days relative study start.

text: hover Hover event main plot. ggdata_y List data frames returned create_ggdata_y(). initial_data Data frame returned prep_data(). color_map Named vector hexadecimal color codes, returned color_lookup(). Names represent event groups. x_scale Character string containing either "date", "day". Reveals current x-axis setting. y_screen_pct Y mouse position window screen (0 1) time_range Datetime numeric vector, length 2. Indicates limits x-axis main detail plots.

title: Create info box for hovering over the main plot of dv.clinlines — create_hover_info
text: shiny wellPanel object displays event type (group), timepoint date (moment), interval dates (start, end), details event (details) hovered subject main plot.

what: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
title: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
text: Wrapper serves interface defining application modulemanager

title: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
code: mod_clinical_timelines(   module_id,   basic_info = default_basic_info(),   mapping = default_mapping(),   drug_admin = default_drug_admin(),   filter = NULL,   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   default_plot_settings = list(x_param = "day", start_day = NULL, boxheight_val = 60),   ms = 1000,   receiver_id = NULL )

title: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
text: module_id [character(1)] character string serves unique identifier module. basic_info [list(character(1)+)] list four elements: data, trt_start, trt_end, icf_date. Assigns name subject level dataset column names treatment start end, informed consent variables. mapping [list(list(list(character(1)+)))] list lists. serves instruction event take data domain / dataset, variables take start end values, etc., plotted clinical timelines. Elements need follow certain structure described Details section . drug_admin [list(character(1)+) | NULL] list named character strings describes variables use display drug administration events. Set NULL deactivate . filter [list(list(character(1)+)) | NULL] list specifies information local adverse events filters. Set NULL (default) filters. subjid_var [character(1)] Character name unique subject identifier column datasets (default USUBJID). Must single value. default_plot_settings [list(character(1), integer(1), integer(1)) | NULL] named list containing three elements: x_param contains either "date" "day" defining x axis shows date study days default setting app launch (defaults "day"), start_day contains integer indicating lower x-axis limit case study day display (defaults NULL, using day earliest event displayed), boxheight_val contains value 30 150 defining initial height individual timeline plot boxes app launch (defaults 60). ms [numeric(1)] Single numeric value indicating many milliseconds wait plot re-renders. Defaults 1000. receiver_id [character(1) | NULL] Character string defining ID module send subject ID. module must exist module list. default NULL disables communication.

title: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
text: list containing following elements used modulemanager: ui: UI function dv.clinlines module. server: server function dv.clinlines module. module_id: unique identifier.

title: Wrapper that serves as interface for defining an application in the modulemanager — mod_clinical_timelines
text: basic_info list must contain following elements: data: Character name subject level analysis dataset (e.g. "adsl", "dm") called datalist provided modulemanager. trt_start: Character name variable contains treatment start dates must present dataset mentioned data element. trt_end: Character name variable contains treatment end dates must present dataset mentioned data element. icf_date: Character name variable contains informed consent dates must present dataset mentioned data element.  list provided mapping must follow strict hierarchy. must contain one entry per dataset/domain serves basis events. entries need named according names datalist provided modulemanager. entries oneself must lists.  second level lists contain variable names needed plot events, gathered yet another lists, named according labels shall assigned event, contain following elements : start_dt_var: Character name variable contains either event start dates (interval events) merely timepoints (e.g. milestones). variable name must present dataset event listed. end_dt_var: Character name variable contains event end dates. Needs provided interval events, set NULL timepoints. variable name must present dataset event listed. start_dy_var: Similar start_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. end_dy_var: Similar end_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. detail_var: Character name variable contains descriptive information shall displayed event. Can set NULL information. structure mapping parameters one single event mentioned . possible define multiple events one dataset, multiple datasets mapping list. mapping = list(  <data name> = list(    <event label> = list(      start_dt_var = <variable name>,      end_dt_var = <variable name NULL>,      start_dy_var = <variable name NULL>,      end_dy_var = <variable name NULL>,      detail_var = <variable name NULL>    )  ))  NULL, drug_admin list must contain following elements: name: Character name dataset holds drug administration data (e.g. ex domain), called datalist provided modulemanager. start_var: Character name variable contains start dates (e.g. exposure start dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. end_var: Character name variable contains end dates (e.g. exposure end dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. detail_var: Character name variable contains treatment information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. label: Free-text character label drug administration event. exp_dose: Character name variable contains dosis level information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. exp_dose_unit: Character name variable contains dosis unit. Must exist dataset mentioned name element.  NULL, filter defines local filters. far, following filters adverse events available: serious_AE: Filter serious adverse events. soc: Filter system organ classes. pref_term: Filter preferred terms. drug_rel_AE: Filter drug related adverse events. filter parameter must list contains yet another list adverse events filters, named ae_filter, holds following elements: data_name: Character name adverse events dataset. Must available datalist provided modulemanager. label: Character value exactly name adverse events event defined mapping. serious_AE: Character name adverse events variable contains serious adverse events flags (Y/N). soc: Character name adverse events variable contains system organ classes. pref_term: Character name adverse events variable contains preferred terms. drug_rel_AE: Character name adverse events variable contains drug related (causality) flags (Y/N).

text: module_id [character(1)] unique ID string create namespace. Must match ID mod_clinical_timelines_server(). filter_list [list(character(1)+) | NULL] List filter names indicate local filters display. x_param [character(1) | NULL] Either "date" "day" defining x axis shows date study days initial setting app launch. Defaults "day". boxheight_val [integer(1) | NULL] value 30 150 defining initial height individual timeline plot boxes app launch. Defaults 60.

text: shiny UI tagList contains sidebarLayout object.

code: mod_clinical_timelines_server(   module_id,   data_name,   dataset_list,   basic_info = default_basic_info(),   mapping = default_mapping(),   drug_admin = default_drug_admin(),   filter = NULL,   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   start_day = NULL,   ms = 1000,   receiver_id = NULL,   afmm_param = NULL )

title: Create server for dv.clinlines module — mod_clinical_timelines_server
text: module_id [character(1)] unique ID string create namespace. Must match ID mod_clinical_timelines_UI(). data_name [shiny::reactive(character(1)] reactive string name selected set dataset. Usually obtained module manager. dataset_list [shiny::reactive(list(data.frame+))] reactive list named datasets. Usually obtained module manager. basic_info [list(character(1)+)] list four elements: data, trt_start, trt_end, icf_date. Assigns name subject level dataset column names treatment start end, informed consent variables. mapping [list(list(list(character(1)+)))] list lists. serves instruction event take data domain / dataset, variables take start end values, etc., plotted clinical timelines. Elements need follow certain structure described Details section . drug_admin [list(character(1)+) | NULL] list named character strings describes variables use display drug administration events. Set NULL deactivate . filter [list(list(character(1)+)) | NULL] list specifies information local adverse events filters. Set NULL (default) filters. subjid_var [character(1)] Character name unique subject identifier column datasets (default USUBJID). Must single value. start_day [integer(1) | NULL] single integer indicating lower x-axis limit case study day display. Defaults NULL, using day earliest event displayed. ms [numeric(1)] Single numeric value indicating many milliseconds wait plot re-renders. Defaults 1000. receiver_id [character(1) | NULL] Character string defining ID module send subject ID. module must exist module list. default NULL disables communication. afmm_param [list] Named list selection arguments module manager. Expects least two elements: utils module_names defining character vector whose entries corresponding module IDs names.

title: Create server for dv.clinlines module — mod_clinical_timelines_server
text: reactive subject id string list communication modules attribute code contains code used export functionality dv.manager.

what: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: Build collection named constants

title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: ... Named parameters collected constants

title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: Shiny uses strings IDs link UI server elements. E.g: foo_UI(id = ns("foo")) ... foo_server(id = "foo") pattern makes easy programmers fall trap modifying one instance string literal "foo" without modifying rest unaware problem bug hit. also easy mistakes uses "foo" identifier uses (text labels, ...) , often case, parameter explicitly named. One easy fix consists using global variables instead plain string literals. case previous example, mean: ID_FOO <- "foo" foo_UI(ns(ID_FOO)) ... foo_server(ID_FOO) simple addition makes purpose ID_FOO clear also fails gracefully ID_FOO instances updated synchronously along codebase. drawback polluting global namespace identifier variables. easily solved creating container constants, purpose pack_of_constants alias. ID <- pack_of_constants(FOO = "foo", BAR = "bar") ID$FOO "foo" ID$BA Error $.pack_of_constants(ID, BA) : Pack constants "ID" contain "BA" pack constants plain named list enforces elements unique, non-null names. tagged S3 object override extraction operators. use checkmate unnecessary, Good Library(TM) module rely anyways

text: name Character name data frame holds drug administration data (e.g. ex domain) called data_list parameter. start_var Character name variable contains start dates (e.g. exposure start dates). Must present data frame mentioned name element. end_var Character name variable contains end dates (e.g. exposure start dates). Must present data frame mentioned name element. detail_var Character name variable contains treatment information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. label Free-text character label drug administration event. exp_dose Character name variable contains dosis level information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. exp_dose_unit Character name variable contains dosis unit. Must exist dataset mentioned name element.

title: Create a list to be assigned to the drug_admin parameter — set_drug_admin
text: list directly used input drug_admin parameter mod_clinical_timelines() mod_clinical_timelines_server().

what: Create a list to be inserted into a second level list of the mapping parameter — set_event
title: Create a list to be inserted into a second level list of the mapping parameter — set_event
text: Helper function support configuration Clinical Timelines module.

title: Create a list to be inserted into a second level list of the mapping parameter — set_event
code: set_event(   start_dt_var,   end_dt_var = NULL,   start_dy_var = NULL,   end_dy_var = NULL,   detail_var = NULL )

title: Create a list to be inserted into a second level list of the mapping parameter — set_event
text: start_dt_var Character name variable contains either event start dates (interval events) merely timepoints (e.g. milestones). variable name must present data frame event listed. end_dt_var Character name variable contains event end dates. Needs provided interval events, set NULL timepoints. variable name must present data frame event listed. start_dy_var Similar start_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. end_dy_var Similar end_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. detail_var Character name variable contains descriptive information shall displayed event. Can set NULL information.

title: Create a list to be inserted into a second level list of the mapping parameter — set_event
text: list directly used third level list mapping parameter mod_clinical_timelines() mod_clinical_timelines_server().

what: Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
title: Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
text: Gathers data needed plot transforms consistent structure.

title: Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
text: data_list named list data frames provides subject level dataset datasets event specific data. Usually obtained module manager. mapping [list(list(list(character(1)+)))] list lists. serves instruction event take data domain / dataset, variables take start end values, etc., plotted clinical timelines. Elements need follow certain structure described Details section . subjid_var [character(1)] Character name unique subject identifier column datasets (default USUBJID). Must single value.

title: Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
text: data frame including following columns: subject_id: unique subject identifier column. name specified subjid_var. start_dt_var, end_dt_var: Start end dates event. detail_var: information events. set: Name dataset data origins . set_id: Row ID's related dataset. group: Label event types. arrow_right: Flag indicates whether event ongoing/ended specified time range .

title: Set and prepare interval data — set_events_intern
text: Please refer Details section mod_clinical_timelines() instructions define proper mapping.

what: Set and prepare interval for exp data — set_exp_intervals

title: Set and prepare interval for exp data — set_exp_intervals
Set and prepare interval for exp data — set_exp_intervals
text: data_list named list data frames provides subject level dataset datasets event specific data. Usually obtained module manager. mapping list named character strings describes variables use display drug administration events. subjid_var [character(1)] Character name unique subject identifier column datasets (default USUBJID). Must single value.

title: Set and prepare interval for exp data — set_exp_intervals
text: data frame including following columns: subject_id: unique subject identifier column. name specified subjid_var. start_exp, end_exp: Start end dates event. detail_var: Information drug name dosage. set: Name dataset data origins . set_id: Row ID's related dataset. exp_dose: Indicates whether dose treatment increased, decreased stayed compared last dose subject. group: Label event types.

title: Set and prepare interval for exp data — set_exp_intervals
text: mapping list must contain following elements: name: Character name dataset holds drug administration data (e.g. ex domain), called datalist provided modulemanager. start_var: Character name variable contains start dates (e.g. exposure start dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. end_var: Character name variable contains end dates (e.g. exposure end dates) must present dataset mentioned name element. detail_var: Character name variable contains treatment information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. label: Free-text character label drug administration event. exp_dose: Character name variable contains dosis level information. Must exist dataset mentioned name element. exp_dose_unit: Character name variable contains dosis unit. Must exist dataset mentioned name element.

what: Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
title: Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
text: Create dataset local adverse event filters

title: Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
text: filter [list(list(character(1)+)) | NULL] list specifies information local adverse events filters. Set NULL (default) filters. data_list named list data frames provides subject level dataset datasets event specific data. Usually obtained module manager. mapping [list(list(list(character(1)+)))] list lists. serves instruction event take data domain / dataset, variables take start end values, etc., plotted clinical timelines. Elements need follow certain structure described Details section . subjid_var [character(1)] Character name unique subject identifier column datasets (default USUBJID). Must single value.

title: Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
text: subset adverse event dataset containing columns needed local adverse event filters.

title: Create a dataset for local adverse event filters — set_filter_dataset
text: list provided mapping must follow strict hierarchy. must contain one entry per dataset/domain serves basis events. entries need named according names datalist provided modulemanager. entries oneself must lists.  second level lists contain variable names needed plot events, gathered yet another lists, named according labels shall assigned event, contain following elements : start_dt_var: Character name variable contains either event start dates (interval events) merely timepoints (e.g. milestones). variable name must present dataset event listed. end_dt_var: Character name variable contains event end dates. Needs provided interval events, set NULL timepoints. variable name must present dataset event listed. start_dy_var: Similar start_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. end_dy_var: Similar end_dt_var, refers study relative days (instead dates). variable name must present dataset event listed. Can set NULL let module calculate study days according SDTM standard rules. detail_var: Character name variable contains descriptive information shall displayed event. Can set NULL information. structure mapping parameters one single event mentioned . possible define multiple events one dataset, multiple datasets mapping list. mapping = list(  <data name> = list(    <event label> = list(      start_dt_var = <variable name>,      end_dt_var = <variable name NULL>,      start_dy_var = <variable name NULL>,      end_dy_var = <variable name NULL>,      detail_var = <variable name NULL>    )  ))

title: Set choices for Preferred Term filter — set_pts

title: dv.clinlines 1.0.3
text: Initial release dv.clinlines package GitHub.

title: dv.clinlines 1.0.2
text: Catch error occurred case empty datasets. Improve usage default values plot settings. Improve checks date variable types. Add informative error message case plot big.

title: dv.clinlines 1.0.1
text: Fix issue local filters getting reset unintentionally (occurred especially combination dv.filter >= 2.1.0) Solve incompatibility dplyr >= 1.1.0 (note: dv.clinlines now requires dplyr >= 1.1.0 due updates within dplyr::case_when() function) Update code use deprecated afmm$dataset_name parameter afmm$dataset_metadata$name dv.manager >= 2.1.0 Standardize module handling renaming subject identifier using receiver module’s ID inter-module communication Introduce possibility set default plot settings Structure plot legend vertically instead horizontally avoid cropping

title: dv.clinlines 1.0.0
text: first productive release clinical timelines Primary interface: mod_clinical_timelines()

title: dv.clinlines 0.0.4
text: Refactor package Restructure wrapper Generalize -module communication (patient profile modules) Add plot title, legend title, x-axis label better orientation Remove participant dropdown (“Subject View”) rearrange sidebar Impute missing start end dates informed consent dates end participation dates today ongoing Make drug administration event optional

title: dv.clinlines 0.0.3
text: Remove detail view completely Enable communication patient profile module used within dv.manager Shorten hover box display relevant data points Fix variety bugs Refine error messages thrown setting app Prepare code export functionality

title: dv.clinlines 0.0.2
text: Prevent module restarted global filters module manager used. Ensure controls/filters resetted dataset module manager changed. Ensure controls/filters restored properly bookmarking happened. Add ms parameter mod_clinical_timelines() users can specify amount time passes plot main view re-renders.

title: dv.clinlines 0.0.1
text: Change package name clinicaltimelines dv.clinlines.
